result.execSummary:
The defendant Cristian F Perez-Hernandez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Cristian F Perez-Hernandez

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Cristian F Perez-Hernandez in court with attorney Heather L. Johnson.  Defendant Cristian F Perez-Hernandez in custody.  Jennifer Lynn Williams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Sworn as interpreter:Enrique Barbosa.
Upon motion of the State, counts are amended to DISORDERLY CONDUCT, 947.01(1) class B misdemeanor.
As to each of the counts:     Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, and further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. Defendant  examined as to plea, and entered a plea of NO CONTEST.  Court found defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived all constitutional rights. Plea questionnaire waiver of rights and addendum to plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulated to the criminal complaint as factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty of each count and entered a judgment of conviction.
Sentencing proceeded.  The State contacted the victim and her family and they did not wish to be present.  Statements by the State and defense; defendant does not make a statement.
As to count 1: 
The Court ordered the Defendant to serve 90 days in the House of Correction, credit for 134 days time served, 90 days to be applied to count 1 and the balance to be applied to count 2.  
As to count 2:
The Court ordered the Defendant to serve 75 days in the House of Correction, consecutive to count 1 with credit for 44 days time served.  
The court orders that all costs, fees, assessments, surcharges and DNA surcharges be paid in 9 months (4-21-2015) or a civil judgment shall be entered.
The defendant is to have no contact with the victim, MH (dob 7-25-1997).
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief filed.
State's Requested Jury Instructions filed.
Defendant's statement has not been transcribed as it is in Spanish.  The State will not be using statement in its case in chief or rebuttal.  Case remains in trial posture for 7-21-2014.

Sworn as interpreter:  Enrique Barbosa.
AMENDED Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.

Defendant Cristian F Perez-Hernandez in court with attorney Heather L. Johnson.  Defendant Cristian F Perez-Hernandez in custody.  Jennifer Lynn Williams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Amended Information filed by the State adding a count of FALSE IMPRISONMENT, a class H felony, pursuant to 940.30.
Defense counsel has issue as to transcript of discs.  Defendant to be produced; interpreter has been requested.
Defense's Motion in Limine received and filed.
Defense Proposed Jury Instructions received and filed.

Defendant Cristian F Perez-Hernandez in court with attorney Heather L Johnson.  Defendant Cristian F Perez-Hernandez in custody.  Jennifer L Williams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Sworn as interpreter: Brenda Bartholomew.
The State may be filing an amended information adding a charge of False Imprisonment. Defense is now put on notice and that amended information may be filed on the day of trial.
The State will not be using the CD of the defendant's interview as it is all in spanish and will not be obtaining a transcript.  Defense is requesting that if any portion of the statement is used that a transcript be readily available.  Counsels are to discuss further.
Defense counsel does not have the motions in limine and jury instructions to file today, but will file tomorrow, June 26.

Attorney Heather L Johnson in court, defendant Cristian F Perez-Hernandez not in court, in custody.  Jennifer L Williams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant's appearance is waived.   Jury trial is set for 7-21-2014 and defense is requesting an adjourned final pretrial date.  Case is set for 6-25-2014 at 8:15.
filed.

Attorney Heather L. Johnson in court, defendant Cristian F Perez-Hernandez not in court, in custody.  Jennifer Lynn Williams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State has ot tendered an offer to the defense but will so do by the end of the week.
Case set for final pretrial on 5-9-2014 at 8:15am.  Jury trial set for 7-21-2014 at 8:15am.  All final pretrial documents to be filed by the final pretrial hearing.  All motions to be filed by 4-30-2014.  Motions to be heard on FPT date.
Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.

Defendant Cristian F Perez-Hernandez in court with attorney Heather L. Johnson.  Defendant Cristian F Perez-Hernandez in custody.  Jennifer Lynn Williams appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Sworn as interpreter:Enrique Barbosa.
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 31, 2014 at 08:15 am.
Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Norberto & Graciela P.; M P-H dob 7/28/97 their residences, families, workplaces or schools

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.  Defense moves to dismiss for lack of probable cause.  Arguments heard.  Court DENIES motion to dismiss.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.

Defendant Cristian F Perez-Hernandez in court with attorney Louis E. Epps.  Defendant Cristian F Perez-Hernandez in custody.  Tyrone Martin St Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Sworn as interpreter:  Alexandra Wirth
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 20, 2014 at 08:30 am.
